CatDescriptText: Mrs. Alice Allen, clerk of 7144 Vann Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the Federal Government should provide financial aid for students of exceptional ability to further their education when the students are unable to do so for themselves?" answer reads: "Yes, and for the simple reason that there are a lot of exceptionally able students whose parents cannot afford the education. They should receive consideration."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alice Allen wearing eyeglasses, dark coat, and earrings, posed in front of flecked granite wall
